I dont think they knew her condition outright and bullied her for it, they made her the scapegoat because she made herself the easy target. It makes sense when you think about it but the translation kinda throws you off. Also its probably even worse if she tried to socialize, tell people she has that condition and people being skeptic assholes.

to the comments that said people couldn’t tell her organs were switched, you’d be surprised. 
my sister was born without a diaphragm. this caused the organs in her lower half rise up and press against her lungs and heart. doctors were able to fix it, but now her heart is on the wrong side of her chest.
I remember in kindergarten the teacher told us to put our hands on our hearts for the pledge of allegiance. she put her hand on the right side of her chest. the teacher called her out for it and my sister responded “but it is on the right side” the teacher didn’t believe her.
she felt pretty bad because she thought people would think she’s a liar and attention seeker.
she’s fine now. her hearts still on the wrong side and her lung is a little squished but I love her all the same

tldr: people can tell
Cute but too short to be good I think, need more pages to be in the story

I know nobody was looking for the answer: The reason this really hurts even though it seems like nothing is because the bullying adds up. like, she almost certainly thought it wasn't really anything special and probably mentioned it in passing or something like that, but some asshole kids probably said something about it and it made her feel bad. this would cause her to associate her own body with feelings of discomfort, and also show to other kids that its okay to make fun of that person. The bullying just continues and she starts to genuinely hate her own body even though to anyone else it seems so insignificant. at the point the bullying just reinforces her negative beliefs and could very well trigger a desire for self-harm in order to cope. the moral of the story is that people are sensitive, and something that seems like nothing to you could be a huge insecurity or cause of stress for others, but even if those people don't believe it anymore, they deserve to be loved too.
